#summary ModSL diagram language syntax

=== Overview ===
Currently ModSL scripting language supports UML class and collaboration diagrams. 

=== Class Diagrams ===
Sample:
{{{
class diagram MyDiagram (width:640, height:480) { 
   interface MyInterface { 
      method1(); 
   } 
   abstract class MyClass1 implements MyInterface { 
      var1; var2; method1(); abstract method2(); 
   }
   class MyClass2 implements MyInterface { 
      static method1();
      1->0..n(MyClass1);
   }	
} 
}}}

Some notes:
   * The word `diagram` in the diagram definition is optional.
   * `width` and `height` are optional. Without the width and height specified the layout algorithm will try to determine the best diagram size based on the number of nodes and edges.
   * The following entities are supported:
      * `class'
      * 'abstract class`
      * 'interfrace'
   * Supported elements:
     * `var`
     * `static var`
     * `method()`
     * `abstract method()`
     * `static method`
   * Supported relationship operations:
     * `extends`
     * `implements`
     * `n->m` (aggregation). Multiplicity on either end can be a number, `*`, single character or a range like `1..n` 

=== Collaboration Diagrams ===
Sample:
{{{
collaboration diagram MyDiagram { 
   MyClass1:MyObject1->MyClass2:MyObject2.method1();
   MyClass2:MyObject2->:MyObject3.method2()->:MyObject4.method3(); 
}
}}}

Notes:
   * In `Class:Object` notation the class name is optional. `Class:Object`, `:Object` and `Object` are all valid identifiers.
   * Multiple calls can be chained together, such as `obj_a->obj_b->obj_c`
